title: How to write an effective and professional email - Quora

response.answer_text: Writing a professional email is not a difficult thing to do. keep it simple and professional. Here are some important points to pay attention to in a professional email: The subject line: The subject line of your email determines whether or not the email will be read. Keep it smart and go straight to the point. Salutation: Keep the salutation simple but professional. A professional email is similar to a formal letter. So you can’t send a professional email without greeting the recipient. This is done at the beginning and at the end of the email. Keep the content of the email short but concise. The signature: The signature allows the recipient know who sent the email. It carries your name, your email address, your phone number as well as your official address. keep it simple. Proofread your email: Before sending the email, ensure you read through it. Check spellings, make sure there are no abbreviations, check your grammar and check the font type as well as the font size. While writing an effective and professional email. Start your email with an appropriate greeting When writing a letter for professional purposes, an appropriate greeting is extremely important. Your greeting sets the tone for your letter or email message. Try not to be tempted to begin your professional letter with informal salutations like “Hello,” “Greetings,” “Hi There,” or “Good Morning” if you don’t know the name of your contact person. While those informal styles of greeting are fine for casual emails to friends or even for more formal emails you might send out to groups of people, in a professional letter you’ll need to use a personal salutation, one with either a first and/or last name (“Dear Mr. Doe”) or a job title (“Dear Hiring Manager”).
